Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

objectives.en: This course provides an introduction to behavioural economics which lies in the intersection of economics with psychology. It deals with how economic agents such as consumers, investors and managers make choices when not all relevant information is available.
objectives.et: Kursus annab sissejuhatuse käitumusliku ökonoomika valdkonnas, mis oma olemuselt sisaldab elemente nii majandusteadusest, kui ka psühholoogiast. See tegeleb teemadega, mis selgitab, kuidas erinevad majanduses osalevad pooled (tarbijad, investorid ja juhid) teevad otsuseid tingimustes, kus kogu oluline informatsioon pole saadaval.

learning_outcomes.en: After taking the course students will know:
* the main tenets of behavioural economics;
* how the assumptions of rationality fail in theory and in practice;
learning_outcomes.et: * kuidas ratsionaaluse eeldused ei pea - nii teoorias, kui praktikas

learning_outcomes.en: * alternatives to the assumption of rational economic agents;
* how the knowledge about how agents choose can help tailor better policies and better corporate strategies.
learning_outcomes.et: * kuidas kasutada teadmist erinevate osapoolte valikutest, et parendada majanduspoliitikaid ja ettevõtete strateegiat

notes.et: The classes and the exams will be in the classroom.

description.et:
First exam opportunity:
Delta Building Narva mnt 18, 2.15pm - 4.45pm.
Room: TBA.

Second exam opportunity:
Delta Building Narva mnt 18, 2.15pm - 4.45pm.
Room: TBA.

Re-sit exam:
Delta Building Narva mnt 18, 2.15pm - 4.45pm.
Room: TBA.

Assessment method:
The final grade in the course corresponds to the grade in the final exam.
The final exam is comprehensive in the sense that it includes many questions for each and every of the eight topics.
It is a closed-book, mostly multiple-choice exam.
There are three examination dates, see above, these dates are the same for each and every student.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

EST

description.et: Introduction to the course. Topic 1: To Be or Not to Be Rational.
Topic 2: Transaction Utility and Consumer Pricing.
Topic 4: Default Option Bias and Status Quo Bias.
Topic 6: Decisions under Risk and Uncertainty.
Topic 6: Decisions under Risk and Uncertainty (cont'd).

As it is usual, some topic or topics might take longer, so some time in this class is reserved for concluding the last topic. Wrapping up the course. Time to clarify some aspects of the course and for questions and answers.
